Package org.crazyrecipes.recipebuddy

Class RecipeBuddyController

java.lang.Object
org.crazyrecipes.recipebuddy.RecipeBuddyController
@RestController public class RecipeBuddyController extends Object
RecipeBuddyController defines and implements the API calls that we support. On startup, it instantiates a DatabaseController to synchronize filesystem operations. It also implements rate limiting to throttle repeated requests.

  • Constructor Details

    • RecipeBuddyController

      public RecipeBuddyController()
      Instantiates a RecipeBuddyController. Only one instance of RecipeBuddyController will exist. This will also instantiate a DatabaseController to handle the cache and interactions with the filesystem.

  • Method Details

    • readRecipes

      @GetMapping("/api/recipes") public List<Recipe> readRecipes()
      Returns a list of all recipes.
      Returns:
      A list of all recipes

    • createRecipe

      @PostMapping("/api/recipes") public Recipe createRecipe(@RequestBody Recipe newRecipe)
      Creates a recipe with the specified parameters. Assigns the Recipe an ID and returns the newly created Recipe.
      Parameters:
      newRecipe - Recipe to create
      Returns:
      the created Recipe with the assigned ID

    • readRecipe

      @GetMapping("/api/recipe/{id}") public Recipe readRecipe(@PathVariable String id)
      Gets a single recipe by ID. Will result in an HTTP 404 if the recipe cannot be found.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the recipe to get
      Returns:
      The recipe with the given ID

    • updateRecipe

      @PutMapping("/api/recipe/{id}") public Recipe updateRecipe(@RequestBody Recipe newRecipe, @PathVariable String id)
      Updates an existing Recipe with the given parameters. Will result in an HTTP 404 if the recipe to update cannot be found.
      Parameters:
      newRecipe - Recipe containing parameters to update
      id - The ID of the Recipe to update
      Returns:
      The updated Recipe

    • deleteRecipe

      @DeleteMapping("/api/recipe/{id}") public void deleteRecipe(@PathVariable String id)
      Deletes a Recipe with a given ID. Will result in an HTTP 404 if the Recipe to delete cannot be found.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the Recipe to delete

    • cookRecipe

      @PostMapping("/api/cook/{id}") public void cookRecipe(@PathVariable String id)
      Increments a Recipe's times cooked counter. Will result in an HTTP 404 if the Recipe to update cannot be found.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the recipe to update

    • readAllergens

      @GetMapping("/api/allergens") public List<String> readAllergens()
      Gets list of allergens
      Returns:
      The list of allergens

    • updateAllergens

      @PostMapping("api/allergens") public List<String> updateAllergens(@RequestBody List<String> newAllergens)
      Posts list of allergens. Overwrites the old list.
      Parameters:
      newAllergens - List of allergens
      Returns:
      The new list of allergens

    • readIngredients

      @GetMapping("/api/ingredients") public List<String> readIngredients()
      Gets list of ingredients.
      Returns:
      The list of ingredients

    • updateIngredients

      @PostMapping("/api/ingredients") public List<String> updateIngredients(@RequestBody List<String> newIngredients)
      Posts list of ingredients.
      Parameters:
      newIngredients - List of ingredients
      Returns:
      The new list of ingredients

    • readUtensils

      @GetMapping("/api/utensils") public List<String> readUtensils()
      Gets list of utensils.
      Returns:
      The list of utensils

    • updateUtensils

      @PostMapping("api/utensils") public List<String> updateUtensils(@RequestBody List<String> newUtensils)
      Posts list of utensils.
      Parameters:
      newUtensils - List of utensils
      Returns:
      The new list of utensils

    • doSearch

      @PostMapping("api/search") public List<Recipe> doSearch(@RequestBody Search s_query)
      Executes a search and returns the results
      Parameters:
      s_query - Search parameters to use
      Returns:
      Search results, ranked by relevance and quality

    • getPhoto

      @GetMapping("api/photo/{id}") public byte[] getPhoto(@PathVariable String id)
      Gets a photo by ID. Will result in an HTTP 404 if the photo cannot be found.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the photo to get
      Returns:
      The photo with the specified ID

    • putPhoto

      @PostMapping("api/photo/{id}") public void putPhoto(@RequestBody String item, @PathVariable String id)
      Updates a photo by ID. Will create it if it does not already exist.
      Parameters:
      item - New content of the photo
      id - ID of the photo to update

    • backupRecipes

      @GetMapping("api/backup") public List<Recipe> backupRecipes()
      Returns a list of all recipes. Identical to "GET api/recipes".
      Returns:
      List of all recipes

    • restoreRecipes

      @PostMapping("/api/restore") public void restoreRecipes(@RequestBody List<Recipe> newRecipes)
      Restores a list of recipes to the database. Will edit recipes if they already exist, and create them if they don't.
      Parameters:
      newRecipes - List of recipes to restore
